paint.shared.utils

Class PaintLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • paint.shared.utils.PaintLogger

  • public final class PaintLogger
extends Object
    Static logger class for color-coded console and file logging.

    Supports multiple severity levels, formatted messages, and persistent log storage under a projectâ€™s "Logs" directory.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PaintLogger.Level
      Defines log levels with severity rank and display color.

      • PaintLogger

        public PaintLogger()

    • Method Detail

      • setLevel

        public static void setLevel(PaintLogger.Level level)
        Sets the current global log level. Messages below this level are suppressed.
        Parameters:
        level - desired PaintLogger.Level

      • setLevel

        public static void setLevel(String level)
        Sets the log level using a string value. Accepts: "DEBUG", "INFO", "WARN", "WARNING", "ERROR". Defaults to INFO for unknown or null input.
        Parameters:
        level - textual level name

      • initialise

        public static void initialise(Path projectPath,
                              String logBaseName)
        Initializes the logger by creating a "Logs" directory and a new numbered log file. Logs are written to both file and GUI console.
        Parameters:
        projectPath - base directory under which the "Logs" folder will be created
        logBaseName - base name used for the log file

      • close

        public static void close()
        Closes the current log writer if open.

        Logs an INFO message with printf-style formatting.

      • raw

        public static void raw(String text)
        Prints text directly to console without timestamps or level formatting. Useful for inline output such as progress bars.
        Parameters:
        text - raw text to print

      • blankline

        public static void blankline()
        Inserts a blank line in the console and log file.

      • doc

        public static void doc(String header,
                       Iterable<String> lines)
        Prints a structured documentation-style block to console and file.
        Parameters:
        header - header text of the block
        lines - iterable list of lines to display below the header
